caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1–7. 1.
Japonacteon sieboldii (Reeve, 1842)
. RGM 961.831. Locality Anda4. (a) rear view, (b) apertural view, (c) basal view, (d) apical view. For these and remaining figures, all material derives from the Piazencian or Gelasian of the Santa Cruz Formation of Cabarruyan Island or nearby Luzon Island, Philippines. Scale bars = 1 mm. 2.
Japonacteon sieboldii (Reeve, 1842)
. RGM 961.830. Locality Roxas. (a) apertural view. 3.

subSubSection.paragraph: Material. Anda 1 ( 2 ) RGM 961.760 , Anda 2 (fragments) RGM 961.761 , Anda 3 ( 2 ) RGM 961.762 , Anda 4 ( 5 ) RGM 961.763 , AndaDeVos ( 2 ) RGM 961.764 , Roxas ( 2 ) RGM 961.765 , Tiep 2 ( 1 ) RGM 961.766 , Tiep 5 ( 1 ) RGM 961.767 .

Characterization. Shell tall; H 5.95 mm ,
W 2.90
mm; protoconch inclined, 1.1 whorl, DP 0.51–0.54 mm ; nucleus small, DN 0.21 mm ; teleoconch sculpted with punctuated spiral grooves with oval punctuations; strong spiral groove with elongated punctuations below suture; space between grooves increases along the whorl, additional grooves intercalate; aperture narrowly semicircular; columella with weak single fold; umbilicus very narrow to closed.

Remarks. According to
Valdés ( 2008 )
, this species might represent a species complex, because of its variability in shell morphology and broad geographic and bathymetric range.
Valdés ( 2008 )
further mentions that all specimens share a closed umbilicus, yet we also encountered specimens with a very narrowly open or rimate umbilicus.
